sub_topic: Predicting the solubility of inorganic salts in water
message_1: What is the solubility of calcium carbonate in water at 25°C?
message_2: The solubility of calcium carbonate (CaCO3) in water at 25°C is quite low. It is approximately 15 mg/L (milligrams per liter) or 15 ppm (parts per million). This low solubility is due to the formation of a stable and insoluble solid when calcium ions (Ca2+) react with carbonate ions (CO32-) in water. The solubility product constant (Ksp) for calcium carbonate at 25°C is around 3.36 × 10^-8.
